page.title: 03GEOLOGY
page.content: THE AREA IS A CLASSIC AREA FOR{ {GEOLOGISTS.}THE HIGHEST GROUND IS PART OF THE HIGH LEVEL{FOREST OF DEAN {PLATEAU},MUCH OF WHICH IS NOW WOODED, EXCEPT FOR THE SE CORNER, WHICH IS{ {FARMLAND.}THE{PLATEAU}IS DEEPLY CUT BY TWO MAJOR{VALLEYS; COUGHTON VALLEY AND {HOPE MANSELL VALLEY.}THE FORMER IS A PREVIOUS COURSE OF THE{RIVER WYE}AND THE LATTER HAS BEEN ERODED BY THE{ {BAILEY BROOK}EXPLOITING A SOFTER BAND OF ROCK. THE{PLATEAU}IS MADE OF ROCKS OF{CARBONIFEROUS}AGE, AND THE{VALLEYS} HAVE BEEN ERODED IN SOFTER{DEVONIAN} ROCK. THE BOUNDARY BETWEEN THESE TWO IS CLEARLY DEFINED BY THE STEEPLY SLOPING{WOODED}EDGE CLEARLY VISIBLE IN {PHOTOGRAPHS A}AND{D.
